page.title: 17THE LAND
page.content: Around{Higham-on-the-Hill}narrow country roads cut through the farming land.Well trimmed hedges alternate with high screens of Hawthorn.From Lower Farm area a{disused railway stretches towards Stoke Golding.Some lines have been removed and cuttings are now used for grazing, space under the bridges being used by farmers for storage. There are{two farms}in the Rowden House area, one which has a milking herd of 60 cows.In this area there is rough grazing land with small ponds and spinneys.Some land has been ploughed,and some cereals and potatoes are grown.There is a lot of grassland. In the centre of the block is another{Dairy Farm,}two holdings of free range poultry and one of Beef for show.Sheep and Beef;Beef and Horses are managed at two other holdings.
